titleStmt.title: His Majesties most gracious pardon, pleaded at Justice-Hall in the Old-Baily, to several prisoners in Newgate, at an adjournment of the sessions of the peace, and oyer and terminer, held for the city of London and county of Middlesex, on Wednesday the 21st. of March, 1687. And in the fourth year of his Majesties reign.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by George Croom, at the Blue-Ball in Thames-street, near Baynard's-Castle,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
Followed by docket title in mss. on UMI microfilm reel C15.
